title: Swapping imperfect for sound animal
vignette: A farmer pledges an perfect lamb but then exchanges an animal an imperfect one instead.

options.text: Reject the exchange and keep the original special status.
Allow the swap since both belong to him.

title: Regretting an Exchange pledge
vignette: After declaring an exchanged animal, the owner immediately regrets it and wants to rescind.

options.text: Too late—the exchange stands.
Permit annulment due to hasty speech.

title: Community Elder uses exchanged animal for private feast
vignette: A community elder exchanges an animal a central assembly place ram for a similar one and keeps the first for himself at a party.

options.text: He must return it and bring an offering for misuse.
No harm if equal value remains dedicated.

title: Second Exchange attempt
vignette: Someone already swapped one animal and now tries to exchange an animal again for the new one.

options.text: Only the first exchange takes effect.
Each swap works creating multiple animals with special status.

title: Minor declaring an Exchange
vignette: A child tending the flock pronounces an exchanged animal on his father's offering.

options.text: It is void because he lacks authority.
Count it since he spoke sincerely.

title: Exchanging an animal for community offering
vignette: Members of a town attempt to exchange their community offering for a nicer one.

options.text: Community offerings cannot be swapped.
Allow it to enhance the offering.

title: Exchange for a donation animal
vignette: A donor wants to exchange an animal his promised for donation bull for another he later purchased.

options.text: The new bull also becomes special status in addition to the first.
Only the replacement becomes dedicated for special use.

title: Double Exchange confusion
vignette: Two people mistakenly exchange animals animals for each other’s offerings.

options.text: Both exchanges create extra animals with special status.
Cancel the swaps to avoid chaos.

title: Offspring of an exchanged animal
vignette: A calf born from a exchanged animal cow raises the question of special status.

options.text: The offspring is also special status.
Only the mother retains special status.

title: Exchanging an animal female for male Spring Festival lamb
vignette: Before Spring Festival the owner swaps his male lamb for a healthy ewe.

options.text: Invalid swap; keep the male for offering.
Accept the ewe to fulfill the offering.

title: Mumbled Exchange declaration
vignette: The owner speaks unclearly when declaring an exchange, leaving witnesses unsure.

options.text: Without clarity it has no effect.
Assume intent and apply the exchange.

title: Non-member attempting Exchange
vignette: A visiting non-member offers to exchange an animal his animal for a community member's offering.

options.text: Disallow; exchange applies only to community members.
Permit if the owner agrees.

title: Exchange with intent to sell
vignette: The owner swaps a better animal intending to sell the original for profit.

options.text: Both animals remain special status and cannot be sold freely.
Allow sale of one to fund the central assembly place.

title: Different species Exchange
vignette: A goat is switched for an ox dedicated for special use earlier.

options.text: The goat also becomes special status alongside the ox.
Exchange fails because species differ.

title: Exchanged Animal discovered post-offering
vignette: Only after ritually preparing the exchanged animal does the owner realize his error.

options.text: The offering counts though improper.
It is invalid; a new offering is needed.
